technologies.name: Node.js
technologies.description: Node.js is an open-source, cross-platform, JavaScript runtime environment that executes JavaScript code outside a web browser.

technologies.name: Google Maps
technologies.description: Google Maps is a web mapping service. It offers satellite imagery, aerial photography, street maps, 360Â° interactive panoramic views of streets, real-time traffic conditions, and route planning for traveling by foot, car, bicycle and air, or public transportation.

technologies.name: React
technologies.description: React is an open-source JavaScript library for building user interfaces or UI components.

technologies.name: Google Cloud
technologies.description: Google Cloud is a suite of cloud computing services.

technologies.name: styled-components
technologies.description: Styled components is a CSS-in-JS styling framework that uses tagged template literals in JavaScript.

technologies.name: Next.js
technologies.description: Next.js is a React framework for developing single page Javascript applications.

technologies.name: Plausible
technologies.description: Plausible is an open-source alternative to Google Analytics.

technologies.name: lit-html
technologies.description: lit-html is a simple, modern, safe, small and fast HTML templating library for JavaScript.

technologies.name: lit-element
technologies.description: lit-element is a simple base class for creating web components that work in any web page with any framework. lit-element uses lit-html to render into shadow DOM, and adds API to manage properties and attributes.

technologies.name: Google Analytics
technologies.description: Google Analytics is a free web analytics service that tracks and reports website traffic.

technologies.name: Crisp Live Chat
technologies.description: Crisp Live Chat is a live chat solution with free and paid options.

technologies.name: Cloudinary
technologies.description: Cloudinary is an end-to-end image- and video-management solution for websites and mobile apps, covering everything from image and video uploads, storage, manipulations, optimisations to delivery.

technologies.name: Google Cloud CDN
technologies.description: Cloud CDN uses Google's global edge network to serve content closer to users.

technologies.name: Sendinblue
technologies.description: Sendinblue is an email marketing solution for small and medium-sized businesses that want to send and automate email marketing campaigns.

technologies.name: Mailjet
technologies.description: Mailjet is an email delivery service for marketing and developer teams.

technologies.name: Google Workspace
technologies.description: Google Workspace, formerly G Suite, is a collection of cloud computing, productivity and collaboration tools.

technologies.name: Webpack
technologies.description: Webpack is an open-source JavaScript module bundler.

technologies.name: PWA
technologies.description: Progressive Web Apps (PWAs) are web apps built and enhanced with modern APIs to deliver enhanced capabilities, reliability, and installability while reaching anyone, anywhere, on any device, all with a single codebase.

technologies.name: Open Graph
technologies.description: Open Graph is a protocol that is used to integrate any web page into the social graph.

technologies.name: Module Federation
technologies.description: Module Federation is a webpack technology for dynamically loading parts of other independently deployed builds.

technologies.name: HTTP/3
technologies.description: HTTP/3 is the third major version of the Hypertext Transfer Protocol used to exchange information on the World Wide Web.
